Hi all,

We have an application wherein we need to fetch a result set based=
 on a
filter criteria. The filter criteria cannot be specified as part of t=
he
URI as it is a fairly complex object that needs to get into the request
=
body.  So my request-line will be GET \data with the filter criteria
coming=
 in via the entity body. However, from various sources, I gathered
that it =
is not recommended to send data as part of the entity body when
using GET, =
DELETE and so on. However, I could not find this mentioned
explicitly in th=
e HTTP standard. If that is correct, then would it be
advisable to model th=
e Filter as a resource to which I POST my criteria
and it then gives back t=
he result set? The request-line then would be
something like POST \filter w=
ith the filter criteria coming in via the
entity body.
